page.title: 12HOUSING
page.content: There are about 150 houses in this block. Most are owner occupied though a few tied cottages remain but these are not always let to farm workers. Of the 10 council houses in Cratfield 1 is divided into 2 flats & 3 are being bought by their occupiers. There are a few second homes used only at weekends are for holidays. 2 houses are empty but generally houses offered for sale are bought quickly. Tiny attached cottages have been made into one dwelling and the Victorian school, 3 pubs and the Town house have been turned into private houses. The houses date from the 16th century onwards.At the moment in Cratfield and its two hamlets, new houses can only be built within strict limits . There is planning permission for 4 houses and the foundations of two of these are being prepared.
